action.action-desc: Mr. Biggs introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To allow the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to establish a research center for deep space and interplanetary research, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Space Research Innovation Act.

section.header: Research Center for Deep-Space and Interplanetary Research

subsection.text: The Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, using the authority under section 2304(c)(3)(B) of title 10, United States Code, shall—

paragraph.text: establish a university-affiliated research center to facilitate capabilities in support of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration;
use such a university-affiliated research center to fund analyses and engineering support related to cis-lunar and deep-space missions and interplanetary research; and
ensure such a university-affiliated research center—

subparagraph.text: is held accountable for the technical quality of the work product developed under this section; and
has established expertise in convening academic and private sector groups to facilitate research and private-public partnerships.

subsection.text: The Administrator shall develop and implement policies and procedures to govern, with respect to the establishment of the university-affiliated research center under subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: the award of cooperative agreements or other contracts;
the appropriate use of competitive awards and sole source awards; and

subsection.text: The following entities shall be eligible to participate in a university-affiliated research center established under subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: an institution of higher education (as defined in section 102 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1002));
an operator of a federally funded research and development center; and
a nonprofit or not-for-profit research institution.
